title: Leveraging Prior Knowledge in Instructional Design: A Qualitative Research-Based Practical Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Learners are current practitioners exploring methods to integrate prior knowledge required for designing social sector education programs within enterprises.

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three types of prior knowledge (personal experience, professional networks, design frameworks).
Learners can apply a decision-making process to improve existing instructional design cases by leveraging prior knowledge in a PBL (Project-Based Learning) environment.
Learners can propose creative solutions by utilizing shared schemas (collective prior knowledge) in team-based design activities.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
